nodes.text: No, I can find things myself thank you.

nodes.text: Where can I find a quest to go on?
nodes.title: <player>

nodes.text:
The minimap in the top right corner of the screen has
various icons to show different points of interest. Look
for the icon to the left to find quest start points.
nodes.title: EMPTY

nodes.text:
Greetings, adventurer. I am Phileas, the Lumbridge
Guide. I am here to give information and directions to
new players. Is there anything I can help you with?
nodes.title: Lumbridge_Guide

nodes.text:
Well, I've heard my friend the cook is in need of a spot
of help. He'll be in the kitchen of this here castle. Just
talk to him and he'll set you off.
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text: What monsters should I fight?
nodes.title: <player>

nodes.text:
look behind the windmill there's a field full of cows to
kill. Non-player characters usually appear as yellow dots 
on your minimap, although there are some that you
won't be able to fight, such as myself. If you explore
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text:
further afield you may be able to find areas which are
less crowded, but watch out for the monsters which are
tougher than you. A monster's combat level is shown
next to their 'Attack' option. If that level is coloured
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text:
green it means the monster is weaker than you. If it is
red, it means that the monster is tougher than you.
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text:
Remember, you will do better if you have better
armour and weapons and it's always worth carrying a
bit of food to heal yourself.
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text:
There is a field a little distance to the north of here
packed full of cabbages which are there for the picking.
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text:
The minimap in the top right corner of the game
screen has various icons showing the locations of things.
This icon to the left shows where Fishing spots are.
nodes.title: EMPTY

nodes.text:
You will need some Fishing equipment. At the Fishing
spots to the south you can only use a small fishing net.
nodes.title: EMPTY

nodes.text: How do I fish?
nodes.title: <player>

nodes.text: Where could I find one of those?
nodes.title: <player>

nodes.text: own one already.
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text:
You can get them from a Fishing shop or our Fishing
Tutor south of here in the swamp. There is a Fishing
shop in Port Sarim; you can find it on the world map.
Port Sarim is some way to the west of here, beyond
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text: the village of Draynor.
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text: Is there anything else you need help with?
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text: Where can I find meat?
nodes.title: <player>

nodes.text:
Fishing spots require different levels and equipment to
use. To start Fishing, you'll want to talk to the Fishing
tutor who can be found in the swamps to the south of here.
He will also give you a small fishing net if you don't
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text:
There is a range at the southers end in this town and
a Cooking tutor in south Lumbridge near Bob's Brilliant
Axes shop.The minimap in the top right corner of the game
screen has various icons showing the locations of things.
This icon to the left shows where Cooking ranges are.
nodes.title: EMPTY

text.ENG: How do I get cabbages?
How do I fish?
Where can I find meat?

nodes.text:
I suggest you go and kill some chickens. The roads on
either side of this river eventually go past a chicken
farm. When you have killed some chickens, cook them.
You could either make a fire or use a range.
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text: How do I make a weapon?
nodes.title: <player>

nodes.text:
The Smithing skill allows you to make armour and
weapons. Talk to the boy who smelts metal in the
furnace, I'm sure he can help.
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text: No thank you.

nodes.text: Look for this icon in the west of Varrock.
nodes.title: EMPTY

nodes.text:
The minimap in the top right corner of the game
screen has various icons showing the locations of things.
This icon to the left shows where Mining sites are.
nodes.title: EMPTY

nodes.text:
You will find a helpful Smithing tutor in the west of
Varrock - that's north of here. Follow the path across
the river and head north.
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text:
I suggest you go and mine some ore; find the Mining
symbol - wit hthe guide symbol near it - in the swamp
south of here. The mining guide there can teach you
how to mine ore.
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text: Is there anything else you need help with?
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

text.ENG: Yes please.
No thank you.

nodes.text: Yes please.
nodes.title: <player>

nodes.text: No thank you.
nodes.title: <player>

nodes.text:
Well, you can go to the Wilderness. That is the area
for killing other players. Just keep heading north and eventually you will be bound to reach it. Be very
careful, though. Player-killing is not for the unprepared.
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text:
Well, you can make them, buy them or talk to the
combat tutors just west of here.
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text:
There is no other staff like this in all the land. It's a
very important staff. It shows who holds the job as the 
Lumbridge Guide, and that's me.
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text:
You can get a weapon free from the combat tutors if
they think you need it. Failing that, the nearest shop
that would sell you something of that nature is Bob's
Brillian Axes in this very town. If you want a bigger
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text:
choice I suggest you head to one of the big cities. If
you follow the road east over the bridge and then head
north you will eventually reach Varrock, where you can
buy all manner of things. You can use the world map
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text: to help  you find your way.
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

text.ENG: Where can I find a weapon?
How do I make a weapon?
Where can I buy a weapon?

nodes.text: Where can I find a weapon?
nodes.title: <player>

nodes.text: Is there anything else you need help with?
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text:
If you visit the combat tutors south of the general store
they may be able to help you with that. Failing that
there are a few cheap weapons lyring around in the
world. For example, you can get an iron dagger if you
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text:
cross the bridge and look in the little hut where some
goblins live. If it's not there it probably means someone
else has taken it. If you wait a while a new one should
appear. As you explore you may find other weapons,
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text: too.
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text:
I'd suggest that you leave and items you don't want to
lose in the bank and take a good supply of food with
you.
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text:
Well, you can make them, buy them or talk to the
combat tutors just west of here.
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text:
There are many different foods in the game such as
cabbage, fish, meat and many more. Which do you wish
to hear about?

nodes.text: I'd like to know about something else.
nodes.title: <player>

nodes.text:
There's lots of beasts to fight in the woods around here,
especially to the west. There are certainly some goblins
and spiders that are pests and could do with being
cleared out. If you follow the road to the north and
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text:
There are many ways to make money in the game. I
would suggest either killing monsters or doing a trade
skill such as Smithing or Fishing.
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

text.ENG: Yes please
No thank you.

nodes.text: No thank you.
nodes.title: <player>

nodes.text: Where can I get food to heal myself?
nodes.title: <player>

nodes.text:
everything, all easily searched and it's even written and
maintained by players.
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text:
Please don't try to get money by begging off other
players. It will make you unpopular. Nobody likes a
beggar. It is very irritating to have other players asking
for your hard-earned cash.
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text:
What you'll want is the OSRS Wiki! I've taken the
liberty of opening the useful links section of the account
management tab for you. Here you can find a link to
the wiki. There's information and guides on almost
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

text.ENG: Where can I smith?
How do I fish?
What monsters should I fight?
I'd like to know about password security.
I'd like to know more about avoiding item scamming.
I'd like to know more about in-game moderation.
I'd like to know about the Stronghold of Security.

nodes.text: I'd like to know more about security.
nodes.title: <player>

nodes.text: I'd like to know about password security.
nodes.title: <player>

nodes.text: I'd like to know about the Stronghold of Security.
nodes.title: <player>

nodes.text: I'd like to know more about avoiding item scamming.
nodes.title: <player>

nodes.text: I'd like to know more about in-game moderation.
nodes.title: <player>

nodes.text:
Well, the first thing to remember with password
security, which I can't stress enough, is to never tell
your password, bank PIN or authenticator details to
anyone, not even if they claim to be Jagex staff. Real
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text:
Jagex staff will NEVER ask for your password.
Sharing your account is a very bad idea, even if you think that you know and trust the person you are
sharing with. Players have lost items and even their
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text: account this way. Sharing accounts is also against the rules.
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text:
Yes, also be very careful where you enter your password.
Be aware that fake Minescape websites
exist. These are sites that claim to give things such as
item/stat upgrades, free items, beta testing and
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text:
Yes, also be very careful where you enter your password.
Be aware that fake Minescape websites
exist. These are sites that claim to give things such as
moderator applications. Jagex does not offer any of
these services.
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text:
Also be aware of trojans and keyloggers. These nasty
programs can send everything you type into your device back to the computers of malicious people, so you
can lose more then just your Minescape
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text:
password in this way. To avoid getting these on your
device, be very wary of what you download, especially when it comes to downloading third party software. Also
be very wary of email attachments and instant
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text: messenger file transfers, which can contain such things.
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text:
Finally, remember the game doesn't censor your
password or bank PIN when you type them; anyone
who tells your otherwise is probably trying to steal your
character or items.
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

text.ENG: I'd like to know more about getting weapons.
I'd like to know about something else.
No thank you.
Tell me more about security.
I'd like to know about something else.
No thank you.

nodes.text: Is there anything else to be aware of?
nodes.title: <player>

nodes.text: I'd like to know more about security.
nodes.title: <player>

nodes.text: I'd like to know about something else.
nodes.title: <player>

nodes.text: No thank you.
nodes.title: <player>

nodes.text:
There are many nice and helpful players in Minescape;
unforutnately, as in real life, there are
some who aren't so honest. Some poeple may try to
trick you out of your items. Try not to fall for this as
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text:
Jagex policy is to never return lost items to players that have been scammed. Doing so just encourages
users to claim they lost items they never had to gain an
unfair advantage. However, people carrying our such
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text: scams will get banned as it is against the rules.
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text:
When trading, you have a second trade confirmation
screen. Always double check that you are getting the
items you expect on this page as some people may try
and change what they are trading at the last second on
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text:
the first trade screen. Remember when you have
clicked accept on the second trade screen, the trade is
not reversible.
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text:
Try and find out from someone else what an item is
before spending a lot of money on it. Not all merchants
are honest about the rarity or the uses of their wares.
For example, some people try to pass off spinach rolls as
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text: rare when in fact they're as common as cabbages!
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text: Be wary of people offering to improve your items. For example, some people claim they can add a trim to your armour or upgrade your sword to a more powerful one. This is not possible and they are trying
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text: to steal your hard-earned equipment.
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text: Is there anything else you need help with?
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text: Is there anything else you need help with?
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text:
You will, from time to time, see moderator characters in
game. Remember: a real staff member will never ask
for your password or any other personal information.
There are two types on moderator. You may see Jagex
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text:
staff characters in game - these can be identifies by a
gold crown next to their name and are the people who
work in the Jagex offices. They might be from
Customer Support, or they might be a tester or a
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text:
programmer. You may also see player moderators - these can be identified by a silver crown next to their
name. Player moderators are trusted players of
Minescape that help keep in-game behaviour in
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text: How do I become a player moderator?
nodes.title: <player>

nodes.text: line with the Minescape rules.
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text:
The only way to become a player moderator is to know
and play by the rules laid down by Jagex. Report those
who break the rules, help players who need it and one
day you might find an invite to become a moderator in
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text:
your Minescape inbox. Note that Jagex will
never contact you in game or by email to become a
player moderator.
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text:
An exciting new discovery has been made in the
Barbarian Village. Soon after they started mining in the
middle of the village, one of the miners got caught in a
cave.
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text:
no, but it turned out that he had discovered a place
unlike any other.
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text: Sounds painful, did he fall on his head?
nodes.title: <player>

nodes.text:
Well an explorer went to look down there, it's full of
new and exciting creatures and other suprises on top
of that. It turns out this place can also help you to
secure your account more effectively.
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text:
Wow, that sounds good. Where can I find the explorer
to learn more?
nodes.title: <player>

nodes.text:
Sadly the explorer went missing and has not been
found. However, here is some information to get you
started on securing your account. You can find the
Barbarian Village north of Falador and west of Varrock.
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

You'll find a bank upstairs in Lumbridge Castle - go
right to the top.

screen has various icons showing the locations of things.
This icon to the left shows where banks are.

nodes.text:
I can also tell you about password security, avoiding
item scamming and in-game moderation. I can also tell
you about a place called the Stronghold of Security,
where you can learn more about account security and
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text: Is there anything else you need help with?
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text: Is there anything else you need help with?
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text: Yes please.
nodes.title: <player>

nodes.text:
First I must warn you to take every precaution to
keep your Minescape password and PIN secure. The
most important thing to remember is to never give your
password to, or share your account with, anyone.
nodes.title: Lumbridge Guide

nodes.text: have a bit of an adventure at the same time.
